text: James Harvey "Jamie" Kennedy (born May 25, 1970) is an American stand-up comedian, television producer, screenwriter and actor. He was born in Upper Darby, Pennsylvania. He came to prominence in the late 1990s for playing Randy Meeks in the Scream movie series. Kennedy formed a production company called Wannabe Producers, alongside Josh Etting, through which he has produced the shows The Jamie Kennedy Experiment, Blowin' Up, The Starlet, and Living with Fran. Following Malibu's Most Wanted, in which he both wrote and acted, Kennedy co-wrote the MTV show Blowin' Up (2006) featuring his friend Stu Stone. In 2008, Kennedy released the documentary Heckler, about the plight of stand-up comics versus their often-aggressive audiences. == Filmography == Year Title Role Notes 1989 Dead Poets Society Extra Uncredited 1994 VR Troopers Elmo Episode: "Cybertron" 1994 California Dreams Hiccup Guy Sea Kelp 2 episodes 1995 Unhappily Ever After Stoney / Pony Burger Attendant (voice) 3 episodes 1995 Ellen Tad 2 episodes 1996 Romeo + Juliet Sampson 1996 Scream Randy Meeks 1997 Coax Jamie Short film 1997 Bongwater Tommy 1997 On the Edge of Innocence Luke Canby TV Movie 1997 Clockwatchers Eddie 1997 Perversions of Science Spaceman John Episode: "Panic" 1997 Sparkler Trent 1997 Scream 2 Randy Meeks Blockbuster Entertainment Award for Favorite Supporting Actor -
